author: Tevo
title: PCDiscord - Bot to Assign Roles
description: It takes resources to maintain and moderate a large Discord channel

assessments.note: The problem and the solution are clear and objective. The proposal is within the scope of the challenge and can assist in the administration of the Catalyst server on Discord. This proposal has a considerable impact in relation to her budget, which I see as a great cost-benefit ratio, as Catalyst's Discord is being the most engaged tool in the community and needs to be improved in order to maintain the onboarding capacity. It is a priority for the Catalyst community.
A bot helps automate administrative tasks and the time saved can be used for other meaningful activities. Very good fit for the challenge.

Once the server gets extremely big, bots might sure help to organize the discord server if properly programmed. Since the activity on the server is still relativeely low at the moment, it needs to be determined whether this is neccessary already.

I believe that, since there is currently no restriction regarding roles assignment, the process could very well be automated and this would save admin's time, which they could use to focus on more productive work. It's a small improvement, but since the budget is small as well, it is appropriate.

The two proposers are moderators on the Discord Catalyst server, are already involved with the Catalyst community and participated in Swarm Sessions. The team is involved in the development of Landing Page and other improvement initiatives in Catalyst. The team has skills to execute the proposal.

The described plan is simple and sufficient due to the low complexity of the proposal. On the Miro board there is more information about the rationale of the proposal and the plan. There is a reasonable, week-long timeline.

There are details on budget allocation and the hours needed to carry out the different stages of development.

The listed components for the bot are very detailed and therefore I am pretty sure that the relevant knowledge is there. However, I would have liked this aspect to be listed somehow under the relevant experience.

The proposers seem to have a lot of experience with the structure of the Discord, however not with programming (at least it is not mentioned under relevant experience). A realistic time budget is presented.

Since the proposer is an experienced Discord channel admin, I see that this proposal is completely feasible in the defined time frame. Also, each step is clearly detailed. Although, the proposal states that this is a mini proposal that would cost 3000 ADA, but is asks for 500, but maybe it's a typo. Also, I didn't understand the roles that were mentioned in the text. It seems like a general text that would fit other mini proposals, but it could be clearer. Obs.: This assessment is very similar to the one in Bot to Assign Channels, because the proposal text is almost the same as well.

No clear discussion on how the bot will actually decide if people should be allowed to have a role they want. Seems the proposers don't actually have people to do it yet. Most of proposal is a copy paste of another proposal.

There is clarity in the problem, solution and the proposal is aligned with this challenge.

There are details on the number of hours required for the development of each stage of development, the budget is reasonable and there are details on the allocation of resources according to the hourly load x hourly payment.

There is a simple one-week timeline. There are objective KPIs.

As the proposal involves low complexity, the audit is relatively simple and there are sufficient elements to carry out such an audit.
The KPIs listed are meaningful and the functions to be implemented are very detailed. It is clear that the applicant has already put a lot of thought into this.
The proposal all in all is detailed enough to be able to be evaluated, however some important details are missing, like details on the functionalities of the bot.

Since this project is very simple, it would be easy to audit and confirm that it has been performed according to the plan, specially because it would be an open source development. Also, KPI is clearly stated and it is sufficient to evaluate the proposal impact. Obs.: This assessment is very similar to the one in Bot to Assign Channels, because the proposal text is almost the same as well.

solution: Integrate a bot into Discord what helps users govern ourselves
experience: Project Manager, Discord moderator. Passionate about the project.
